articles.author: Nathan Layne, Brendan Mcdermid, Jeff Mason
articles.description: Donald Trump was shot in the ear during a campaign rally on Saturday after a major security lapse, an attack that will likely reshape this year’s presidential race and fuel long-standing fears that the campaign could descend into political violence.
articles.title: Trump survives assassination attempt at campaign rally after major security lapse

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Islamist group Hamas has not withdrawn from ceasefire talks after this weekend's deadly Israeli attacks in Gaza, one of the group's senior officials said on Sunday.
articles.title: Hamas says it has not withdrawn from ceasefire talks after latest Israeli attacks

articles.author: Aaron Josefczyk, Jasper Ward, Kanishka Singh
articles.description:
The FBI identified 20-year-old Thomas Matthew Crooks of Bethel Park, Pennsylvania as the suspect in Saturday's attempted assassination of former U.S. President Donald Trump at a campaign rally.
The suspect was shot and killed by the Secret Service seconds after he allegedly fired shots toward a stage where Trump and was speaking in Butler, Pennsylvania.
The FBI said it was working to determine a m
articles.title: Here's what we know about Thomas Matthew Crooks, the suspected Trump rally shooter

articles.author: James Oliphant, Gram Slattery
articles.description: In a country already on edge, the assassination attempt on former President Donald Trump has enraged his supporters, paused the Democratic campaign and raised fears of further political violence in the run-up to November's election.
articles.title: Attack on Trump could spark further U.S. political violence

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Four people were wounded, one critically, when a suspected attacker rammed into a bus stop in central Israel on Sunday, Israeli authorities said.
articles.title: Four people wounded in car ramming attack in central Israel

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Voters in Rwanda headed to the polls on Monday to elect their next president, with 66-year-old incumbent Paul Kagame who has ruled the central African country for nearly a quarter of a century expected to cruise to victory.
articles.title: Rwandans vote in election expected to extend Kagame's long rule

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Rescuers in Nepal ruled out chances of finding survivors in last week's landslide that swept two passenger buses carrying 65 people into a river swollen by heavy rain, authorities said on Monday.
articles.title: No hope of survivors in Nepal bus accident, 55 still missing

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Following are reactions from world leaders to the shooting attack on Donald Trump at an election rally on Saturday in which the former U.S. president was wounded in the ear:
articles.title: Trump shooting: Reactions from world leaders

articles.author: Jennifer Rigby, Christy Santhosh
articles.description: More children were left out of critical vaccination drives for diseases such as diphtheria, tetanus and whooping cough last year as a rise in conflicts across the globe hindered the supply of life-saving shots mostly in strife-torn regions, the United Nations said on Monday.
articles.title: Rising conflicts globally slowed childhood vaccination rate in 2023, UN says

articles.author: Jarrett Renshaw, Nandita Bose
articles.description: U.S. President Joe Biden's reelection campaign is scrambling for a new strategy after an assassination attempt on Republican rival Donald Trump in western Pennsylvania, including deciding to call off attacks on the former president for now.
articles.title: Biden, Democrats scramble after Trump rally shooting upends campaign
